intro: Campanula megrelica, commonly known as the Megré bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Campanula megrelica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
